Against El Paso On Friday, July 13th, a shipper group filed a complaint against El Paso Nat= ural Gas alleging that the pipeline has oversold capacity into California d= ue in part to unlimited growth of demands by full requirements customers. = The complainants request: (1) that all full requirements customers be converted to contract demand cu= stomers at reasonable levels; (2) a mandatory expansion of the pipeline system to be used to meet El Paso= 's existing firm transportation obligations; and (3) that FERC prohibit El Paso from collecting demand charges for firm serv= ice it is unable to provide until such time as El Paso can show that it is = capable of meeting its firm service obligations. A Technical Conference in El Paso's Order No. 637 proceeding (RP00-336) is = scheduled for Wed., July 18, 2001 to discuss El Paso's systemwide capacity = allocation issues, which will include topics addressed in the complaint.=20
